etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Edward Dana (1849–1935), mineralogist and physicist. From German Maskelynit from the name of Mervyn Herbert Nevil Story-Maskelyne, English mineralogist, who made several studies of the composition of meteorites + German -it

definitions: A colourless glassy aluminosilicate of calcium and sodium with the composition of plagioclase, found in certain kinds of meteorite.
